remarks: Construct lexicographic order on a function space based on a reverse well-ordering of the indexes and a well-ordering of the values. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-May-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ wemapwe as of 3-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
wemapweOLD.t $e |- T = { <. x , y >. | E. z e. A ( ( x ` z ) S ( y ` z ) /\ A. w e. A ( z R w -> ( x ` w ) = ( y ` w ) ) ) } $.
wemapweOLD.u $e |- U = { x e. ( B ^m A ) | ( `' x " ( _V \ { Z } ) ) e. Fin } $.
wemapweOLD.2 $e |- ( ph -> R We A ) $.
wemapweOLD.3 $e |- ( ph -> S We B ) $.
wemapweOLD.4 $e |- ( ph -> B =/= (/) ) $.
wemapweOLD.5 $e |- F = OrdIso ( R , A ) $.
wemapweOLD.6 $e |- G = OrdIso ( S , B ) $.
wemapweOLD.7 $e |- Z = ( G ` (/) ) $.
wemapweOLD $p |- ( ph -> T We U ) $.
$d A w x y z $.
$d B x y $.
$d F w x y z $.
$d G x y $.
$d R w z $.
$d S z $.
$d U x y $.
$d Z x $.
$d ph x y $.
